column4: Can someone help me, I need to autostart my wireless card, and I'm not using ndiswrapper
Can someone help me, I need to autostart my wireless card, and I'm not using ndiswrapper
you can put the settings in /etc/network/interfaces
what settings need to be added?
have you read any of the wifi documentation yet?
What wifi doc? I can manually load the drivers by going to the directory and ./wlan0up
give that a go - if it doesn't work, then we'll go through it
when I  sudo ifdown eth0, I get 'interface eth0 not configured'
what wifi card are you using? make/model?
its a realtek, I'm not sure of model.
what shows up for it in lspci?
and now my wireless card doesn't work at all
